body:
I think this is the error

```
#48 [linux/arm64 builder 5/6] RUN   CGO_ENABLED=0   make
#48 205.2 # cd /go/src/github.com/rclone/rclone; git status --porcelain
#48 205.2 fork/exec /usr/bin/git: invalid argument
#48 205.2 error obtaining VCS status: fork/exec /usr/bin/git: invalid argument
#48 205.2 	Use -buildvcs=false to disable VCS stamping.
#48 205.3 make: *** [Makefile:54: rclone] Error 1
#48 ERROR: process "/bin/sh -c CGO_ENABLED=0   make" did not complete successfully: exit code: 2
```

Not really sure what caused that. That error message `-buildvcs=false to disable VCS stamping.` is a message from the go compiler

Why did it stop working? Was it because we went to go1.23 from go1.22?

Or maybe something simpler like `git` being missing from the build image, or a wrong architecture git.

I suspect changing to docker/build-push-action@v6 like we use for the beta build rather than https://github.com/ilteoood/docker_buildx which we use for historical reasons will fix the problem.

Any thoughts?

In the mean time I can build the docker image manually...

Hi @ncw ,

Thank you for your response.

I forked the project and tried the following:

1. No modifications (**failed**, [logs](https://github.com/ttionya/rclone/actions/runs/10829568358))
2. Using the git version that was used before, git=v2.45.2-r0 (**failed**, [logs](https://github.com/ttionya/rclone/actions/runs/10829665679))
3. Not building to `linux/arm64` platform (**failed**, [logs](https://github.com/ttionya/rclone/actions/runs/10829832178))
4. Building with `golang:1.22-alpine` (**not failed, still building**, [logs](https://github.com/ttionya/rclone/actions/runs/10829985018))
5. Use `docker/build-push-action` instead of `ilteoood/docker_buildx` (**not failed, still building**, [logs](https://github.com/ttionya/rclone/actions/runs/10832095295))

Based on these attempts, I believe the compilation error only occurs with the latest version of Golang (1.23) in combination with `ilteoood/docker_buildx`. I am not sure about the historical reasons for using `ilteoood/docker_buildx`, but I think it would be better to replace it with `docker/build-push-action`.

Since the master branch already includes the content of `v1.69`, I think manually building `v1.68` is a good option.

issue.title: Fix the failure in building the release Docker image

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

The recent v1.68 release build failed. Replacing `ilteoood/docker_buildx` with `docker/build-push-action` can resolve the issue. A successful build was performed at https://github.com/ttionya/rclone/actions/runs/10832095295.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8062

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: Hi, I have created a PR to replace `ilteoood/docker_buildx` with `docker/build-push-action`. Feel free to comment or close the PR if it is not suitable.

@ttionya fantastic testing - thank you :-)

I just tried a very similar change on my test rig and that seems to work, so I think I will merge yours - thank you!
I have pushed 1.68 up to docker hub now :-)

Thank you for your response.

I noticed that the new `v1.68` image is missing the build for the `linux/arm/v6` platform. Is there an issue with it?

Thanks @ttionya - my manual build instructions were out of date :-(

I've kicked that build off now - it should arrive shortly :crossed_fingers:
Thanks @ttionya - I did not know that. I've fixed that now :-)
Now everything looks good. Thank you very much.
